title: ETFs That Limit Your Losses—for a Price
text:
Anew kind of exchange-traded fund promises to protect investors from losses by borrowing a strategy from the annuities world. It’s gaining favor as volatility roils markets and investors seek ways to stem potential losses without giving up the chance for growth.

Buffer ETFs, also called defined-outcome ETFs, work like cheaper, more liquid versions of traditional structured products: They absorb a certain amount of market losses and, in exchange, limit the gains that investors can get on various indexes. The bigger the buffer,...
description: Buffer funds can limit investors’ losses. The trade-off is a cap on potential gains. How to tell if they’re right for you.
